course.subject: LIFS
course.name: Immunobiology
course.description: Cellular, biochemical and genetic basis of immunity; cells in immune response, antigens and antigen recognition; antibodies and the generation of diversity; major histocompatibility complex; cell mediated immune response; regulation of immune response; autoimmunity, tissue transplantation and rejection.
course.prerequisites: LIFS 2040/2210, and LIFS 3140

reviews.author: PhatPhellow
reviews.comment_content: The content covers the basic information about immunology and introduces many of the important discoveries and how they were achieved. Very interesting content, however, there is a lot of information that you need to learn/memorise. Attending the lecture is a must if you want to do well for the exams because the lecture slides are mainly diagrams and pictures that are difficult to understand without context.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is very knowledgable about the topic and can answer all questions. He is able to explain complicated concepts very well and can go slowly if people don't understand. Many of the concepts will be extremely difficult without his teaching and explaining.
The prof will also explain some important information that will come up during the exam and sometimes he also mentions which information and which slides you will need to know for the exam.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading was OK, because a lot of the concepts and content was difficult. I got lucky and managed to get a good grade mainly because I went to lectures and took notes.
reviews.comment_workload:
The content of this course is very large and there is quite a bit of memorization involved. Understanding is also very important to answer questions in the exams (so make sure you attend the lectures!)
1 midterm and 1 final. The final exam is not cumulative but some knowledge from the first half will be needed.
There are also a few in-class open-note quizzes and he will usually mention it on the day. The quiz will be at the end of the class, but it is very easy to get full marks. Just make sure you are there in class.

reviews.author: LKY
reviews.comment_content: Too much for u to digest,most of the slides only include complicated pictures without words.U have to attend the lectures,otherwise you don't know the main point of the slides.
reviews.comment_teaching: A good thing of the professor is that he would tell us which slides will appear in exam questions and what contents you have to memorize.
reviews.comment_grading: Grade is not so good. Because the exam is quite difficult.
reviews.comment_workload:
1 midterm and 1 final. The amount of exam content is huge.
And 2 open notes quizzes 5% for each.You can get full marks as long as you attend the quiz no matter what u answer
